conclusion: Analyze the graph to determine the relationship between the particle's position x and time t.
The image shows a graph with x/m on the vertical axis and t^2/s^2 on the horizontal axis. The graph is a straight line with a slope of 6.
The graph shows x as a function of t^2, indicating that the position of the particle is proportional to the square of time.
The equation of the line can be expressed as x = 6t^2.
To find the velocity v, differentiate x with respect to time t: v = dx/dt = 12t.
To find the acceleration a, differentiate the velocity with respect to time: a = dv/dt = 12.
The magnitude of the acceleration is the absolute value of a, which is 12 m/sÂ².
